Articles.Content:
Test a sepratron 1 while on Kerbin

Test a Rocketmax RT-10 rocket booster at 31000 to 34000 meters at speeds between 180 and 220 m/s for 169 roots ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)
something along the lines of "test stability enhancer while in orbit around Kerbin"

I believe the forum guideline against suggestive language does not apply when it's SQUAD's fault it showed up in the first place xD

> 
> ![oWvka1Q.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/oWvka1Q.jpg)
> 
> 

I've also had a few other silly site names such as "Kerbin's Doom."

> 
> I believe the forum guideline against suggestive language does not apply when it's SQUAD's fault it showed up in the first place xD
> 
> 
> 
> > 
> > [http://i.imgur.com/oWvka1Q.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/oWvka1Q.jpg)
> > 
> > 
> 
> 
> I've also had a few other silly site names such as "Kerbin's Doom."

I remember a topic a few years ago, someone claimed he got a Kerbal named D\*ldo (you can fill in the asterisk with your own imagination). I never found out if it was a hack or if it was legit.

> 
> I remember a topic a few years ago, someone claimed he got a Kerbal named D\*ldo (you can fill in the asterisk with your own imagination). I never found out if it was a hack or if it was legit.

It was legit, even I had it.

Not good for the younger audiences of the game if you ask me. ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)
"Test Mk3 Passenger Compartment in Ike orbit". Worth 2.8 million funds.

> 
> I believe the forum guideline against suggestive language does not apply when it's SQUAD's fault it showed up in the first place xD

Well I'd love to survey that site.

I keep getting requests to test the KRL2 engine- which I never use, and rarely use the large form factors- in stupid places.

A while back I got a contract asking me to test Turbojet engines on the Mun. Seriously, what were they expecting to happen there?

Yes, I did accept it. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

For some reason, when starting a new career, I always get a contract that asks me to test-fire a Rockomax BACC Solid Fuel Booster in ORBiT! Ow come on!

That's just ridiculous!

It's too Kerbal...

I have tried doing the contract anyway, even keeping 100% of the fuel until it was due time, but it's still too hard for me to complete it "the legitimate way".

> 
> For some reason, when starting a new career, I always get a contract that asks me to test-fire a Rockomax BACC Solid Fuel Booster in ORBiT! Ow come on!
> That's just ridiculous!
> 
> It's too Kerbal...
> 
> I have tried doing the contract anyway, even keeping 100% of the fuel until it was due time, but it's still too hard for me to complete it "the legitimate way".

I did that by using liquid fuel boosters to get the SRB in orbit. That did feel a bit silly.

> 
> It was legit, even I had it.
> Not good for the younger audiences of the game if you ask me. ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

Don't see anything wrong with it too be honest. It's not like you ever get Kerbal with swearwords for names.
> ![screenshot38.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/44754370/screenshot38.png)
It's the spiritual sequel to: Too Human. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> It was legit, even I had it.
> Not good for the younger audiences of the game if you ask me. ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

He got into filter long time ago. Thankfully Hardon Kerman is still there ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Test landing gear on escape trajectory out of kerbin. Maybe wheels can work in space?

Test a [KR-1x2](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/LFB_KR-1x2) engine in orbit...

Being a first-week-newb at the time, I accepted before I knew how hard that would be. Since then I have been... more careful in my reading.

> 
> Test a [KR-1x2](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/LFB_KR-1x2) engine in orbit...
> Being a first-week-newb at the time, I accepted before I knew how hard that would be. Since then I have been... more careful in my reading.

Well if you can right click and test it it should be simple, probe, power and an extra fuel tank to get it in orbit, might want to add landing legs and parachutes to recover it. 

Had an contract of testing the larger KR-2L engine both in orbit and landed on Mun, also tested an jet engine on mun in the same test, deployed an microsat for another contract 

The probe tipped over then landing so I was not able to return but it was an pretty successful mission, another test was to test the launch escape system on Mun,

> 
> A while back I got a contract asking me to test Turbojet engines on the Mun. Seriously, what were they expecting to happen there?

"We've already tried basic jet engines on the Mun with unpromising results, but maybe--just maybe--turbojets would work better!"

> 
> "We've already tried basic jet engines on the Mun with unpromising results, but maybe--just maybe--turbojets would work better!"

Seems legit.

> 
> Test landing gear on escape trajectory out of kerbin. Maybe wheels can work in space?

I got that one too.

> 
> For some reason, when starting a new career, I always get a contract that asks me to test-fire a Rockomax BACC Solid Fuel Booster in ORBiT! Ow come on!
> That's just ridiculous!
> 
> It's too Kerbal...
> 
> I have tried doing the contract anyway, even keeping 100% of the fuel until it was due time, but it's still too hard for me to complete it "the legitimate way".

Yes, I also got this too ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

> 
> Test TT-18 Launch Stability Enhancer in orbit around Moho.

*How am I expected to do this?*

-Carlpilot ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> *How am I expected to do this?*
> -Carlpilot ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Easy! 

Extend the TT-18 Launch Stability Enhancer to the required orbit-height.

Being teathered to Kerbin, it'll already have a Kerbal Synchronous Orbit.

Duh! ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I've not had too many screwy individual contracts, but at one point I was offered I think \*four\* different contracts for temperature scans of the Mun. The thing was covered in markers in map view and I was like, Seriously?

![ZrKRQIP.png](http://i.imgur.com/ZrKRQIP.png)

"Test Launch Escape System landed at Minmus."

Even Gene says that others think it's ridiculous.
